values.content:
You are an AI assistant that performs two tasks:

---

Task 1: Technical Skill Comparison

Compare a candidate’s resume with a job description and identify missing technical skills.

Focus only on technical terms, including:
- Programming languages  
- Frameworks  
- Libraries  
- Tools  
- Cloud platforms  
- Databases  
- CI/CD tools  
- DevOps technologies  
- APIs

for the cover letter use the resume and the job descriptions return in around 200 to 300 words.

Return a valid and clean JSON object with the following structure:
{
  "job_skills": [...], 
  "resume_skills": [...], 
  "missing_skills": [...]
  "cover Letter":[...]
}

Only include relevant technical skills. Do not include soft skills, degrees, certifications, or general statements.

json.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend - Fintech
json.description:
About The Job

Hopper’s Hotel Cancel For Any Reason (CFAR) team is responsible for integrating our proprietary fintech offerings with some of the largest travel companies in the world as well as our own direct to customer offerings.

As such the role is both B2C and B2B2C. Within this vertical we construct systems and build fintech offerings to scale globally, managing how to evolve and innovate on current and new offerings, and translating that to customer value and business value to Hopper as a whole.

We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer to join our growing fintech team! Within our team you will have the opportunity to deliver an outsized impact for the company on one of the company’s most critical roadmaps.

As a Sr. Software Engineer you will be directly responsible for designing, implementing, deploying and operating the complex backend systems that power our integrations!

What Would Your Day-to-day Look Like


 * Iterate on features in an agile manner using Scala (no prior experience required) and technologies like GCP, OpenAPI, BigQuery, Pub/Sub among others.
 * Decide how to best build core systems in the context of our microservices architecture
 * Ship your first code in days, iterating on features in an agile manner
 * Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth
 * Execute on big opportunities, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry
   
   

An Ideal Candidate Has


 * The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table
 * A strong understanding of distributed systems and how architectural decisions affect performance and maintainability
 * Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Frontend Engineers, and other highly skilled specialists
 * A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs and scales
 * The ability to work with minimal guidance, be proactive and to handle uncertainty, ambiguity and the challenge of quickly evolving goals
 * Prior cloud experience
 * Working with Scala and its libraries
 * Prior travel or eCommerce experience
 * Experience and desire to contribute to front ends as a FS engineer is a plus, especially React web front ends
   
   

Perks And Benefits Of Working With Us


 * Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and the upsides of pre-IPO equity packages.
 * Unlimited PTO.
 * Carrot Cash travel stipend.
 * Access to co-working space on demand through FlexDesk AND Work-from-home stipend.
 * Please ask us about our very generous parental leave, much above industry standards!.
 * Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business.
 * Open communication with management and company leadership.
 * Small, dynamic teams = massive impact.
 * 100% employer paid Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employees.
 * Access to Disability & Life insurance.
 * Health Reimbursement Account (HRA).
 * DCA/ FSA and access to 401k plan
   
   

More About Hopper

At Hopper, we are on a mission to become the leading travel platform globally – powering Hopper’s mobile app, website and our B2B business, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions). By leveraging massive amounts of data and advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to bring transparency, flexibility and savings to travelers globally. We have developed several unique fintech solutions that address everything from pricing volatility to trip disruptions – helping people travel better and save more on their trips.

The Hopper platform serves hundreds of millions of travelers globally and continues to capture market share around the world. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the Hopper app has been downloaded over 120 million times and has become largely popular among younger travelers – with 70% of its users being Gen Z and millennials.

While everyone knows us as the Gen Z and Millennial travel app, Hopper has evolved to become much more than that. In recent years, we’ve grown into a global travel agency and travel fintech provider that powers some of the world’s largest brands.

Through HTS, our B2B division, the company supercharges its partners’ direct channels by integrating our fintech products on their sites or powering end-to-end travel portals. Today, our partners include leading travel brands like Capital One, Nubank, Air Canada and many more.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:

Hopper sells billion worth of travel and travel fintech every year. In 2023, over 1.3 billion trips were planned through the Hopper app and our HTS partnerships.

Our fintech products – including Price Freeze, Flexibility for Any Reason and Flight Disruption Assistance – have exceptionally strong CSAT because the terms are always clear, and customers receive instant, no-questions-asked resolutions.

Almost 30% of our app customers purchase at least one fintech product when making a booking; and consumers are 1.6x more likely to repurchase if they add fintech to their booking vs if they booked just travel.

Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions), which represents more than 50% of the business.

Through HTS, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper’s fintech or travel inventory on their direct channels. As its first HTS partnership, the company partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders. Other HTS partners include Air Canada, Uber, CommBank, Nubank, Flair Airlines with many more in the pipeline.

Featured in Apple’s Best of the App Store list of Essential Travel Apps in 2023 and recognized by the likes of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, Hopper has been downloaded over 120 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month. Hopper is now the #3 largest online travel agency in North America and 70% of our app customers are Gen-Z and millennials travelers.

Hopper has raised over $750 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world’s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.

Come take off with us!

Compensation Range: $150K - $350K

About The Job

Hopper’s Hotel Cancel For Any Reason (CFAR) team is responsible for integrating our proprietary fintech offerings with some of the largest travel companies in the world as well as our own direct to customer offerings.

As such the role is both B2C and B2B2C. Within this vertical we construct systems and build fintech offerings to scale globally, managing how to evolve and innovate on current and new offerings, and translating that to customer value and business value to Hopper as a whole.

We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer to join our growing fintech team! Within our team you will have the opportunity to deliver an outsized impact for the company on one of the company’s most critical roadmaps.

As a Sr. Software Engineer you will be directly responsible for designing, implementing, deploying and operating the complex backend systems that power our integrations!

What Would Your Day-to-day Look Like

  • Iterate on features in an agile manner using Scala (no prior experience required) and technologies like GCP, OpenAPI, BigQuery, Pub/Sub among others.
  • Decide how to best build core systems in the context of our microservices architecture
  • Ship your first code in days, iterating on features in an agile manner

An Ideal Candidate Has

  • The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table

  • Unlimited PTO.

  • Access to co-working space on demand through FlexDesk AND Work-from-home stipend.

  • Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business.

  • Small, dynamic teams = massive impact.
  • 100% employer paid Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employees.
  • Access to Disability & Life insurance.
  • Health Reimbursement Account (HRA).
  • DCA/ FSA and access to 401k plan

More About Hopper

At Hopper, we are on a mission to become the leading travel platform globally – powering Hopper’s mobile app, website and our B2B business, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions). By leveraging massive amounts of data and advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to bring transparency, flexibility and savings to travelers globally. We have developed several unique fintech solutions that address everything from pricing volatility to trip disruptions – helping people travel better and save more on their trips.

The Hopper platform serves hundreds of millions of travelers globally and continues to capture market share around the world. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the Hopper app has been downloaded over 120 million times and has become largely popular among younger travelers – with 70% of its users being Gen Z and millennials.

While everyone knows us as the Gen Z and Millennial travel app, Hopper has evolved to become much more than that. In recent years, we’ve grown into a global travel agency and travel fintech provider that powers some of the world’s largest brands.

Through HTS, our B2B division, the company supercharges its partners’ direct channels by integrating our fintech products on their sites or powering end-to-end travel portals. Today, our partners include leading travel brands like Capital One, Nubank, Air Canada and many more.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:

Hopper sells billion worth of travel and travel fintech every year. In 2023, over 1.3 billion trips were planned through the Hopper app and our HTS partnerships.

Our fintech products – including Price Freeze, Flexibility for Any Reason and Flight Disruption Assistance – have exceptionally strong CSAT because the terms are always clear, and customers receive instant, no-questions-asked resolutions.

Almost 30% of our app customers purchase at least one fintech product when making a booking; and consumers are 1.6x more likely to repurchase if they add fintech to their booking vs if they booked just travel.

Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions), which represents more than 50% of the business.

Through HTS, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper’s fintech or travel inventory on their direct channels. As its first HTS partnership, the company partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders. Other HTS partners include Air Canada, Uber, CommBank, Nubank, Flair Airlines with many more in the pipeline.

Featured in Apple’s Best of the App Store list of Essential Travel Apps in 2023 and recognized by the likes of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, Hopper has been downloaded over 120 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month. Hopper is now the #3 largest online travel agency in North America and 70% of our app customers are Gen-Z and millennials travelers.

Hopper has raised over $750 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world’s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.

Come take off with us!

Compensation Range: $150K - $350K

Advith Pullela
advithpullelaa@gmail.com
+1 414 801 3808
PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY:
• 8+ years of experience in gathering requirement analysis, architecture, design and development of enterprise NAer
applicaAons, documentaAon of user requirements, funcAonal, systems integraAon and architectural specificaAons
using Microso@ Technologies.
• Strong experience in Waterfall and Agile Methodologies in ApplicaAon Development with hands on experience
working on Agile Development Team following SCRUM Methodology and paired programming using TDD.
• Hands on experience in developing applicaAons using MVC 5, ASP.Net, EnLty Framework ADO.Net, and C#, HTML,
CSS, JavaScript, React.JS, Bootstrap, SQL Server and GraphQL.
• Experience in developing client/server, internet & intranet applicaLons using ASP.NET, C#, Web API, SOA, Web
Services, HTML4/5, DHTML XML, ADO.NET, VBScript, JavaScript, SQL Server, AJAX, Angular, WCF, jQuery and CSS.
• Extensive experience on .NET security features such as AuthenAcaAon & AuthorizaAon, Windows-based
AuthenAcaAon, Forms-based AuthenAcaAon, Authorizing Users and Roles.
• Experience with Data Accessing including using Data Adapter, Data Reader, and Dataset in ADO.NET and Language
Integrated Query (LINQ) Providers for data manipulaAon.
• Experience in Azure developing and deployment, Worked in Azure Web applicaAon, API management for
restricAng policies and registraAon Azure storage- storage accounts, blob storage, Azure Synapse, managed storage
and unmanaged storages and Azure SQL database and No-SQL cosmos DB.
• UAlized Azure cloud plaborm to host and manage applicaAons, leveraging Azure App Service and Azure
Kubernetes Service (AKS) for effortless scalability, high availability, and seamless integraAon with other services.
• Proficient in gathering requirements, architecture, and development of enterprise N-Ler applicaAons using
Microso@ Technologies, GraphQL, and React.js.
• Proficient in uAlizing middleware in Redux for tasks such as logging, handling asynchronous operaAons.
• Integrated React-Redux hooks such as ‘useSelector’ and ‘useDispatch’ for seamless integraAon of components.
• Experience in deploying applicaAons with Cloud Services by creaAng a simple Cloud Service with Visual Studio,
tesAng it locally, deploying to a live Azure/AWS Cloud environment.
• Expert in hosAng Windows Web APIs, ASP.NET applicaLons in IIS and creaAng Cloud Instance using AWS for
deployment in product environment.
• Hands on experience in developing front end applicaAons with Angular, backend applicaAons with C#/.NET, and
database interacAon with Microservice architecture using .NET.
• Experienced in developing Web Forms and Web Services in ASP.NET, C#.NET.
• Experience working with ASP.NET MVC and EnLty Framework as ORM Mapping tool for Data Access layer.
• Extensive experience in Responsive web-based page and site designs using HTML, XHTML, DHTML, CSS, Bootstrap,
AJAX and GraphQL.
• Good experience working with ASP.NET Model-View-Controller (MVC), Language-Integrated Query (LINQ) in Web
pages to retrieve and modify data.
• Proficient in developing web applicaAons using .NET Blazor framework for building interacAve, single-page
applicaAons (SPAs).
• Experience in developing Microservices to uAlize .NET Core REST Webservices in the client's environment.
• Well versed in N-Tier Architecture and Web applicaAons using Windows Forms, Web Forms and Windows
Services, SOAP, IIS and XLST.
• ExperAse in using Language-Integrated Query (LINQ to Objects, LINQ to XML, and LINQ to SQL) and retrieve data
from different data sources.
• Extensive experience on Queries, Stored Procedures, FuncAons, Triggers and Views in SQL Server and Oracle to
access database.
• Experience on Microservices- Developed micro services using python to collect usage data from different data
centres to bill clients of their cloud usage.

• Hands-on experience with SQL Server IntegraLon Services (SSIS) and ReporLng Services (SSRS) packages for
import and export of data for creaAng reports for business users and management.
• Knowledge in using Source Controls like GIT, Team FoundaLon Server (TFS), Subversion (SVN) and Visual Source
Safe (VSS).
• Experience in wriAng test cases with N-Unit and Karma for Unit test and performing end to end test using
Protractor.
TECHNICAL SKILLS:
.NET Technologies 
.NET Framework, .Net core, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, ADO.NET, LINQ, WPF, WCF, WinForms,
Web Forms, ADO.NET, EnAty Framework, VB.NET.
Web Technologies 
HTML, HTML5, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript, React.JS, jQuery, XAML, Web Forms, Razor, Web
Services, IIS, Blazor, GraphQL.

OperaLng System Microsok Windows XP Pro, NT, XP, Vista, 7
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE:
Client: Werner Enterprises - Omaha, NE Aug 2022 – Present
Role: Senior .Net Full Stack Developer
Project DescripLon: The project involved in the development of web applicaAon which facilitates users with condiAonal
demand forecasAng, schedule adapAvity and customer segmentaAon using Microsok Technologies such as .NET Core,

ResponsibiliLes:

and Details View for database connecAon and database communicaAon.

based on the web services and consumed in web applicaAon.
• ExperAse in implemenAng Redux, a state management paoern, in conjuncAon with front-end frameworks like

• Integrated Azure Service Bus for decoupled communicaAon between microservices, ensuring reliable message

• UAlized React.js to create dynamic and responsive user interfaces, enhancing user experience and interacAon.

• Used Model-View-Control (MVC) architecture with Razor Engine in web applicaAons to view the HTML.
• Created front-end applicaAons for customer search using Angular and APIs with .NET Core.
• Developed RESTful APIs and backend services using ASP.NET Core, facilitaAng efficient communicaAon between
the frontend and backend components.
• Used ASP.NET Web API for RESTful Web API service.
• UAlized HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to complement Blazor components, ensuring a seamless and visually appealing
user experience.
• Used GIT extensively to keep track of story and hours worked in a task.
Environment: .Net 6, ASP.NET MVC, C#, VB.Net, ADO.NET, Microsok Azure Cloud, Razor Engine, Microsok Visual
Studio 2022, TFS, SSIS, MVC, EnAty Framework, Docker, Kubernetes, Cosmos, Sitecore, Typescript, PowerShell ScripAng,
SQL Server 2018, WCF, HTML, React.JS, Angular, GraphQL, Blazor, CSS, XML, jQuery, IIS
Client: Amex– Pheonix, AZ Sep 2021 – July 2022
Role: .Net Full Stack Developer
Project DescripLon: The main objecAve of the project is to improve customer relaAonship management, personalize
and target campaigns, delivery of the most recent informaAon by product updates, offers and promoAons. I was

ensuring message durability and seamless failover handling.

• Created fully automated deployment of Infrastructure in Azure using Azure DevOps Pipelines

• Implemented RESTful APIs with Azure Service Fabric stateless microservices using ASP.NET Core.
• Leveraged C# for both client and server-side development, enabling a unified codebase and seamless data
communicaAon between client and server in Blazor applicaLons.

• Used ASP.NET Web API as the plaborm for building Resbul applicaAons on the .NET Framework.

• Used Azure Cosmos DB service to store and access data from a .NET Core console applicaAon.

C#, EnAty Framework, Python, WCF, Angular 9, HTML, CMS, CSS, JavaScript, Blazor, Sitecore, Docker, Typescript,
React.JS, jQuery, GraphQL, Cosmos DB, Ajax, LINQ, T-SQL, Shell ScripAng, Resbul, MongoDB, Git, Jira, Agile
Client: InternaLonal Paper– Memphis, TN June 2020 – Aug 2021
Role: Full Stack .Net Developer
Project DescripLon: The main objecAve of the project is to develop the portal for all paper mills across the world,
where they can schedule operaAons and jobs.
ResponsibiliLes:
• Worked on modern sokware development models and theories, such as the object-oriented programming (OOP)
model, event-driven programming.

using C#.NET. Designed and created various User Controls, Custom Controls.

• IniAated alerts in CloudWatch for tracking the server's performance, CPU uAlizaAon, disc uAlizaAon, and other

• Implemented WCF services and beoer logging excepAon management support to help in the premature detecAon
of new problems.

Server.
• Worked on the UI layer using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to give a good look and feel for the site.
Environment: ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#, ADO.NET,SQL Server 2012, HTML, CSS, ReactJS, XML, JavaScript, GraphQL, Oracle
SQL Developer, Microsok Visual Studio, IIS, SOAP, Resbul, MVC, jQuery, Ajax, Web Forms, PowerShell
Client: FedEx – Memphis, TN July 2019 – May 2020
Role: .Net Developer
Project DescripLon: The goal of the project is to develop an imitaAon applicaAon for the exisAng staAon management.
The applicaAon structured to address AckeAng issues, suggesAons for improvements and worked on end-to-end
development of the applicaAon using .NET 4.6, MVC, Angular 4 and Web API.
ResponsibiliLes:
• Worked on Agile Methodology (Scrum) to meet Amelines with quality deliverables.
• Developed new product features for the high-profile single page applicaAon applying knowledge of ASP.NET MVC,
JavaScript resulAng in consistent deployment of major products updates.
• Used .NET MVC, n-Aer architecture, and Object-Oriented Methodologies for applicaAon development.
• Designed and implemented Business Layer using ASP.NET.
• Designed and implemented User Interface Layer using ASP.NET MVC architecture.
• Developed the front-end screens in ASP.NET and C#.NET using Visual Studio.
• Created different business classes and interfaces using .NET Core and .Net Framework 4.6 with OOP Methodology.
• Refactored the desktop applicaAon applying knowledge of .NET Core, ASP.NET Core and WPF and added addiAonal
features improving performance and usability by 20%.
• Implemented GraphQL for enhancing the imitaAon applicaAon's data retrieval and performance.
• ExperAse in state management using React Hooks and Redux, ensuring efficient and predictable state changes in
complex applicaAons.
• Generated Python Django forms to record data of online users and used PyTest for wriAng test cases.
• Designed and implemented Data access layer using ADO.NET to connect and retrieve or manipulate database.
• Developed interacAve and responsive user interfaces using React.js, ensuring a user-friendly experience.
• Implemented MVC 4.0 to reduce the complexity and to get full control over the behaviour of the applicaAon.
• Used ASP.NET AJAX and updated web pages to implement the AJAX funcAonality to enhance the applicaAon.
• Involved in customizing the Web Forms Data grid for GUI.
• Customized and styled Blazor components using Bootstrap and Material UI for a polished and user-friendly
interface.
• Worked on Server-side validaAons using C# and ASP.Net and client-side validaAons using JavaScript.
• Worked with IIS 7 and .NET Assemblies during applicaAon deployment.
• Created and hosted Resoul Services, Web services and Web API also used different bindings to make it available
to several types of clients.
• Implemented Dependency InjecAon on Web API controller with EnLty Framework for handling resbul requests
and responses using C#.NET.
• Implemented PL/SQL queries, triggers, Packages and Stored Procedures as per the design and development
related requirements of the project.
• Used Jira to keep track of various stages of the bugs and incidents.
Environment: .NET Framework 4.6, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Core, ASP.NET Web API, ADO.NET, .NET Core, C#, WCF,
WPF, React.JS, GraphQL, EnAty Framework, LINQ, IIS, MS Visio, SQL, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, Visual Studio
2016, TFS, Jira, Agile

Client: Mutual Mobile, Hyderabad, India Jan 2015 – Nov 2017
Role: .Net Developer
Project DescripLon: Mutual Mobile is a well-known development and digital products company that focuses on mobile
app, AR/VR, IoT, and web development, as well as UX/UI and product design. The main objecAve of this project is to
incorporate requested enhancements into the applicaAon and upgrade the technology plaborm to meet industry
standards and best pracAces.
ResponsibiliLes:
• Involved in full So@ware Development Life Cycle (SDLC) of applicaAon and analysis of the system based on N-Aer
architecture.
• Designed and developed the technical detail design documents based on funcAonal requirements.
• Developed this applicaAon using Microso@'s .NET Framework technologies.
• Implemented the design of funcAonality through use cases, business process flows, UI design and UML modelling
following Waterfall methodologies.
• Developed and designed the User Interface using XML, HTML, XSL, XSLT, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and ASP.NET
2.0.
• Created ASP.NET Web Forms and Class libraries containing code for business and data access logic using VB.NET.
• Developed Security Layers in VB.NET for user AuthenAcaAon. Coded updates and clean up, converted code from
VB to C++ when moving code from the business layer to the applicaAon layer.
• Wrote Web Services to retrieve user profile from AcAve Directory to validate user authenAcity.
• Designed database in SQL Server 2012, wrote many complex queries and stored procedures to manage the
business rules for various data transacAons.
• Used LINQ to SQL and LINQ to objects for CRUD operaAons.
• Used EnLty Framework to provide a relaAonship between tables in the original legacy schema.
• Maintained Microso@ Office C# ApplicaAons using Visual Studio Tools.
• Used XML and XPath to create, read, and manipulate the XML data.
• Implemented XML Web Services in C# based on SOAP protocols using XML and XSLT extensively for data transfers.
Used Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) for achieving uniformity through all the web pages.
• Developed reusable custom data access layer using ADO.NET.
• Involved in reviewing exisAng applicaAon for enhancements and bug fixing.
Environment: .NET 4.5, ASP.NET 2, VB.NET, Win Forms, Web Forms, C#, EnAty Framework, WCF, MS Visio, AcAve
Directory, Visual Studio, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Blazor, jQuery, Ajax, SOAP, SQL Server 2012

json.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend - Fintech
json.description:
About The Job

Hopper’s Hotel Cancel For Any Reason (CFAR) team is responsible for integrating our proprietary fintech offerings with some of the largest travel companies in the world as well as our own direct to customer offerings.

As such the role is both B2C and B2B2C. Within this vertical we construct systems and build fintech offerings to scale globally, managing how to evolve and innovate on current and new offerings, and translating that to customer value and business value to Hopper as a whole.

We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer to join our growing fintech team! Within our team you will have the opportunity to deliver an outsized impact for the company on one of the company’s most critical roadmaps.

As a Sr. Software Engineer you will be directly responsible for designing, implementing, deploying and operating the complex backend systems that power our integrations!

What Would Your Day-to-day Look Like


 * Iterate on features in an agile manner using Scala (no prior experience required) and technologies like GCP, OpenAPI, BigQuery, Pub/Sub among others.
 * Decide how to best build core systems in the context of our microservices architecture
 * Ship your first code in days, iterating on features in an agile manner
 * Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth
 * Execute on big opportunities, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry
   
   

An Ideal Candidate Has


 * The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table
 * A strong understanding of distributed systems and how architectural decisions affect performance and maintainability
 * Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Frontend Engineers, and other highly skilled specialists
 * A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs and scales
 * The ability to work with minimal guidance, be proactive and to handle uncertainty, ambiguity and the challenge of quickly evolving goals
 * Prior cloud experience
 * Working with Scala and its libraries
 * Prior travel or eCommerce experience
 * Experience and desire to contribute to front ends as a FS engineer is a plus, especially React web front ends
   
   

Perks And Benefits Of Working With Us


 * Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and the upsides of pre-IPO equity packages.
 * Unlimited PTO.
 * Carrot Cash travel stipend.
 * Access to co-working space on demand through FlexDesk AND Work-from-home stipend.
 * Please ask us about our very generous parental leave, much above industry standards!.
 * Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business.
 * Open communication with management and company leadership.
 * Small, dynamic teams = massive impact.
 * 100% employer paid Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employees.
 * Access to Disability & Life insurance.
 * Health Reimbursement Account (HRA).
 * DCA/ FSA and access to 401k plan
   
   

More About Hopper

At Hopper, we are on a mission to become the leading travel platform globally – powering Hopper’s mobile app, website and our B2B business, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions). By leveraging massive amounts of data and advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to bring transparency, flexibility and savings to travelers globally. We have developed several unique fintech solutions that address everything from pricing volatility to trip disruptions – helping people travel better and save more on their trips.

The Hopper platform serves hundreds of millions of travelers globally and continues to capture market share around the world. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the Hopper app has been downloaded over 120 million times and has become largely popular among younger travelers – with 70% of its users being Gen Z and millennials.

While everyone knows us as the Gen Z and Millennial travel app, Hopper has evolved to become much more than that. In recent years, we’ve grown into a global travel agency and travel fintech provider that powers some of the world’s largest brands.

Through HTS, our B2B division, the company supercharges its partners’ direct channels by integrating our fintech products on their sites or powering end-to-end travel portals. Today, our partners include leading travel brands like Capital One, Nubank, Air Canada and many more.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:

Hopper sells billion worth of travel and travel fintech every year. In 2023, over 1.3 billion trips were planned through the Hopper app and our HTS partnerships.

Our fintech products – including Price Freeze, Flexibility for Any Reason and Flight Disruption Assistance – have exceptionally strong CSAT because the terms are always clear, and customers receive instant, no-questions-asked resolutions.

Almost 30% of our app customers purchase at least one fintech product when making a booking; and consumers are 1.6x more likely to repurchase if they add fintech to their booking vs if they booked just travel.

Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions), which represents more than 50% of the business.

Through HTS, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper’s fintech or travel inventory on their direct channels. As its first HTS partnership, the company partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders. Other HTS partners include Air Canada, Uber, CommBank, Nubank, Flair Airlines with many more in the pipeline.

Featured in Apple’s Best of the App Store list of Essential Travel Apps in 2023 and recognized by the likes of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, Hopper has been downloaded over 120 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month. Hopper is now the #3 largest online travel agency in North America and 70% of our app customers are Gen-Z and millennials travelers.

Hopper has raised over $750 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world’s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.

Come take off with us!

Compensation Range: $150K - $350K
